title: WHIRLING / BATHTUB
description: You can take a bath and wash that corpse stench off.

dialogueTree.title: Bathtub: "This is not the cleanest bathtub in..."
dialogueTree.text: This is not the cleanest bathtub in the world, but it's cleaner than you are right now.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Ah, that soap scum smell. It smells..."
links.text: Ah, that soap scum smell. It smells like life. At least compared to you.

links.title: You: "Run yourself a bath."
links.text: Run yourself a bath.

links.title: Bathtub: "The bathtub slowly fills with water..."
links.text: The bathtub slowly fills with water. The water beckons.

links.title: You: "Undress, close your eyes, and subme..."
links.text: Undress, close your eyes, and submerge.

links.title: Bathtub: "The water doesn't feel particularly..."
links.text: The water doesn't feel particularly clean. A few beer cans are bobbing up and down along your flanks like sad duckies. You pause to think before letting your head go under.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Hold it right there! Keep your head..."
links.text: Hold it right there! Keep your head above water, or you'll lose all those pheromones Morell sprayed on you.

links.title: You: "I don't care. I just want to be eng..."
links.text: I don't care. I just want to be engulfed.

links.title: Bathtub: "The lukewarm water is comforting, l..."
links.text: The lukewarm water is comforting, like amniotic fluid.

links.title: You: "Keep your head above water, just in..."
links.text: Keep your head above water, just in case.

links.title: Bathtub: "The water is only lukewarm, but sti..."
links.text: The water is only lukewarm, but still comforting, like amniotic fluid. A few beer cans are bobbing up and down along your flanks like sad duckies.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You feel nice and lonely. And so, s..."
links.text: You feel nice and lonely. And so, so tired.

links.title: You: "Take the beer cans out."
links.text: Take the beer cans out.

links.title: Bathtub: "Now you are alone with your thought..."
links.text: Now you are alone with your thoughts in the tub. But it's easier than being alone with your thoughts outside the tub.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "They're not even really thoughts. J..."
links.text: They're not even really thoughts. Just assorted sensations, none of them acute enough to focus on.

links.title: You: "Linger in the tub a little."
links.text: Linger in the tub a little.

links.title: Bathtub: "Your fingers grow pale and are cove..."
links.text: Your fingers grow pale and are covered with tiny whorls as the water cools.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "What are you doing? You're not some..."
links.text: What are you doing? You're not some fat fish in a fucking aquarium. Time to get moving.

links.title: You: "Imagine something."
links.text: Imagine something.

links.title: Bathtub: "You see the corpse. You can still s..."
links.text: You see the corpse. You can still smell the cadaver on you. It's going to take more than one bath to get rid of that stench.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Then -- houses along a narrow stree..."
links.text: Then -- houses along a narrow street. A video rental. Darkness on the planet's curvature.

links.title: You: "Get out. (Conclude.)"
links.text: Get out. (Conclude.)

links.title: Bathtub: "The water line recedes as you stand..."
links.text: The water line recedes as you stand. You are cold now. Your clothes stick to your still moist skin.

links.title: You: "Leave the beer cans in."
links.text: Leave the beer cans in.

links.title: Bathtub: "The cans continue to bob, as do you..."
links.text: The cans continue to bob, as do your thoughts, aimlessly splashing up against the sides of the tub.

links.title: You: "I want to live forever with the cor..."
links.text: I want to live forever with the corpse smell. Memento mori and stuff. [Leave.]
